abstracts.cdata!:
The guiding principles behind the
            restructuring of the Rural Land Management and Community
            Infrastructure Development Project of Cote d'Ivoire and
            its implementation are allocation of resources on priority
            activities and concrete short-term goals, including: a)
            Integration of activities within the overall framework of
            the strategy and program of post-crisis output; b) Rapid
            mobilization of resources available through the easing of
            budgetary procedures and rules of procurement and
            disbursement. The main hypothesis for reformulation of the
            Project is as follows: Two (2) years the project will focus
            on the operational components in order to: 1) have concrete
            results and effects on the framework and living conditions
            of populations in areas of the Project; 2) have a high rate
            of disbursement; 3) build on past achievements and results
            of two years to prepare a second phase of twelve (12) years.
            The impact of resettlement caused by development projects,
            if not mitigated, often give rise to economic, social and
            environmental safeguards that may be realized by the
            dismantling of production systems: a) The involuntary taking
            of land and other property causing: The removal or loss of
            shelter; The loss of property or access to assets; Loss of
            income or subsistence products that affected people should
            or should not move to another site; b) The involuntary
            restriction of access to parks and protected areas legally
            designated causing adverse impacts on living conditions of
            displaced persons.
